hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In ${\greenD{4}} = \purpleC{{?}} \div \maroonD{{9}}$, the $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{4}$.

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{9}}$.

![Tape diagram showing question mark is equal to 4 equal groups of 9](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cbd6b25fd98290ea45963548600d23f1bbbf8b16)

The $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{?}$.

Kiley can use these multiplication equations:

- $\purpleC{{?}} = \greenD{4} \times \maroonD{{9}}$
- $\purpleC{{?}} = \maroonD{9} \times \greenD{{4}}$

question.content:
Kiley wants to use multiplication to solve $4 = {?} \div 9$.

**Which two multiplication equations can Kiley use?**
